channel.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
channel.description:
http://news.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/newsitem.ws?id=577
Far better anti-macro technology. Those cheats are in for one huge shock! :-)
any thoughts?

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

PaulT:

By far-better technology, Jagex mean some programmer at upgraded his bosses startup menu icons to be available in the cinnabar, honeydew, and chartreuse shades of green.

Woah…if thats true, cheating as we know it is dead!!

Most likely, their ‘far better’ technology is just a new Client, with more stuff done serverside. (Pain re-doing all the defs -.-)

Read full topic
item.source: Behind the screens May.... new engine

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

What would updating there JDK do?
Ive been on 1.5 for YEARS…
You can only make scar-type macroes with java since 1.5

Read full topic
item.source: Behind the screens May.... new engine

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @theghost14 theghost14
item.description:
@theghost14 wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:20, topic:2276”][quote author=sdcit link=topic=2414.msg22956#msg22956 date=1146630996]

Better compatibility with dual CPU computers.

How can anything they code into a Java applet possibly have an effect on something so hardware-specific?

As for the better macro detection, bring it on. Maybe they can finally kill Aryan.

And updating the JDK would do…what, exactly?

I read that you couldnt de obsfucate it or something, but Jagex couldnt update to the new JDK as there game isnt compaitible with the new JDK.

I feel that if they spent some of their “valuable” time (sarcasm) they’d beable to do it. I REALLY hope they do.
[/quote]

However they did say they have been working on their new engine for 6 months. Seems like plenty of time to me.[/quote]

Took em 2 years to make rs2 u never know if rs3 is on its way.They could have been working on a brand new engine to work with the new java

Read full topic
item.source: Behind the screens May.... new engine

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @ShadowSyntax ShadowSyntax
item.description:
@ShadowSyntax wrote:

intheknow:

But they need to realize a small group of programmers (regardless of how much they are paid) are little match against the thousands of people who macro.

I think they realised that a long time ago… But theres no harm in them trying.
And they have made progress. I find it kind of sad how many noobs there are on cheating forums that think their so much better than Jagex, but their lives completly revolve around their game.

Read full topic
item.source: Behind the screens May.... new engine

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“sdcit, post:18, topic:2276”][quote author=!!1one!eleven1! link=topic=2414.msg22769#msg22769 date=1146609063]

Better compatibility with dual CPU computers.

How can anything they code into a Java applet possibly have an effect on something so hardware-specific?

As for the better macro detection, bring it on. Maybe they can finally kill Aryan.

And updating the JDK would do…what, exactly?

I read that you couldnt de obsfucate it or something, but Jagex couldnt update to the new JDK as there game isnt compaitible with the new JDK.
[/quote]

I feel that if they spent some of their “valuable” time (sarcasm) they’d beable to do it. I REALLY hope they do.[/quote]

However they did say they have been working on their new engine for 6 months. Seems like plenty of time to me.

Read full topic

As for the better macro detection, bring it on. Maybe they can finally kill Aryan.

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @intheknow intheknow
item.description:
@intheknow wrote:

really don't like how you phrased it. like we were all better then them throughout our rs experience. yes, some are pathetic, but others just do it to pass time.

I probably muffled my main argument by throwing in various descriptions. The primary thing I wanted to illustrate is how Jagex slips in game updates that make the rs economy resemble a police state and some players don’t acknowledge it.

Read full topic
item.source: Behind the screens May.... new engine

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:10, topic:2276”][quote]
Better compatibility with dual CPU computers.
[/quote]
How can anything they code into a Java applet possibly have an effect on something so hardware-specific?

As for the better macro detection, bring it on. Maybe they can finally kill Aryan.

And updating the JDK would do…what, exactly?[/quote]

Actually, The blitz languages have problems with duel CPU computers, the frame-rate drops like a bitch, but I think it depeneds on your CPU because some people have problems, others don’t.

About the JDk, appearntly you can’t decompile it or something? I’ve heard Mopar say it a few times, I think.

Read full topic
item.source: Behind the screens May.... new engine

As for the better macro detection, bring it on. Maybe they can finally kill Aryan.

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @John2.0 John2.0
item.description:
@John2.0 wrote:

[quote=“intheknow, post:11, topic:2276”]John, the really sad thing is Jagex arranges the release of their “new plans” so that is sounds fun and appealing to everyone else. It’s like a tyrannical government announcing publically that new laws will be in place to protect ORDER, and the masses cheer and lick it all up in excitement.

Pretty soon the only determining factor for status on Runescape will be how many hours of your life you have wasted on it. Forget playing the market, having rich friends, using computer skills, or being the first one at an update… now it is about loyal puppets who sit passively at their computer praising anything thrown at their boredom.

Yes, that includes a kiddy crane. :P[/quote]

really don’t like how you phrased it. like we were all better then them throughout our rs experience. yes, some are pathetic, but others just do it to pass time.

Read full topic
item.source: Behind the screens May.... new engine

item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

I’m in for an even tougher programming challenge.

They’ll probably start compiling with 1.5.* xD

Read full topic
item.source: Behind the screens May.... new engine

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @intheknow intheknow
item.description:
@intheknow wrote:

John, the really sad thing is Jagex arranges the release of their “new plans” so that is sounds fun and appealing to everyone else. It’s like a tyrannical government announcing publically that new laws will be in place to protect ORDER, and the masses cheer and lick it all up in excitement.

Pretty soon the only determining factor for status on Runescape will be how many hours of your life you have wasted on it. Forget playing the market, having rich friends, using computer skills, or being the first one at an update… now it is about loyal puppets who sit passively at their computer praising anything thrown at their boredom.

Yes, that includes a kiddy crane.

Read full topic

Better compatibility with dual CPU computers.

As for the better macro detection, bring it on. Maybe they can finally kill Aryan.

And updating the JDK would do…what, exactly?

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @John2.0 John2.0
item.description:
@John2.0 wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:8, topic:2276”]edit* Is this there big new update to prevent cheaters?

[quote]Other updates this month include some new random events which ask the player to Grab the Evil Twin. Players operate a winch and crane with a large claw attached to the bottom  similar to the games you can see at fairgrounds. We also see the player being whisked off to a large troll area having to prod the correct pillars, just like a giant pinball machine!

[/quote][/quote]
lol, if it is… it’ll be easy to solve i bet

Read full topic
item.source: Behind the screens May.... new engine

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Perhaps they are updating the JDK?

Either way, they say this every update, whats the diff?

Just read it all, their updates do sound impressive though.

edit* Is this there big new update to prevent cheaters?

Other updates this month include some new random events which ask the player to Grab the Evil Twin. Players operate a winch and crane with a large claw attached to the bottom â€“ similar to the games you can see at fairgrounds. We also see the player being whisked off to a large troll area having to prod the correct pillars, just like a giant pinball machine!

Read full topic
item.source: Behind the screens May.... new engine

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @John2.0 John2.0
item.description:
@John2.0 wrote:

actually, i think they actually might be serious this time. i’ve alrdy seen various changes(like how the banks look on the mm, but they didnt change the key part lol) and we still need someone to make a box solver… but it sorta can’t be done now with the randomness(well, it “can” be done i think, but it would be huge) and the frog is still a bitch. umm… maybe they’ll have a filter or something where they check for certain combos of the chat types, or something to that degree. but… other then a really good mouse detection thing i still think scar will be for the mostpart undetectable by the system. I just hope when they do all the client changes moparscape will still work lol. I love it

Read full topic
item.source: Behind the screens May.... new engine

item.title: Behind the screens May.... new engine
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

[quote=“intheknow, post:3, topic:2276”]No, I believe they will have some minor improvements for detection, etc. But they need to realize a small group of programmers (regardless of how much they are paid) are little match against the thousands of people who macro.

We may have to adjust our strategies, but there will always be cheating.[/quote]Actually it’s more like a small group of programmers against a somewhat larger but still small group of programmers, since coders create the cheats everyone use and a bunch of leechers can’t stop jagex, the end of the kaitnieks forums did get rid of a whole bunch of leechers, but the real coders/constributers are still outnumbered.

Read full topic

We may have to adjust our strategies, but there will always be cheating.
